column4: soooo.... there isnt a control panel/display manager that lets me turn on my 2nd display in ubuntu?
nvidia is twinview and ati is xineram i believe
- give me a sec. did this a few days ago for nvidia
thanks, I just reformated a kubuntu install that went bunk, and it was easy as pie... Ubuntu aint seeming as such :(
so just changing the option to twinview should work? thanks :)
- Yes, just editing xorg.conf should be all you need.
didnt quite work... manage to get X running with the modified config, but no display differences :(
thanks... ill check it out (mine stopped working after hooking up a new hub -- even the old hub wont work now)
- yes, too fragile. Maybe umounted the wrong way.
worked, thanks :) will just setup my stuff command line the first time :)
- ntfs-3g driver? (just curious about nstalling it.)
yah... I didnt have the problem on my external HD but I setup my internal with a shared partition and its like that...
- If you ran ntfs check disk would the partition show up again?
its visible... I can write to it right now... i just cant see like.... my web files I setup under linux....
- Gotta be some journaling record in the registry. - anyone for a conspiracy theory?
I figured out my NTFS problem
